intro: Casparia schlechtendaliana, commonly known as the Schlechtendaliana casparia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture.
